field.name: summary
field.value: Minor change to JS emitted on $Form.EndFormTag - changes prototypeValidators from Array to Object.

field.name: description
field.value:
Changes if (!window.prototypeValidators) prototypeValidators = $A([]);\n to if (!window.prototypeValidators) prototypeValidators = new Object();\n
Associative arrays in JavaScript should derive from Object, not array (or any other type). Using $A([]) creates an empty array to hold the validators that is not used as a conventional (numerically indexed) array, but as an associative array (effectively a map or hash table). Creating an array and using it in this manner makes it nearly impossible to correctly iterate the elements in the array as doing so also iterates all of the methods and properties of the array. Better explanation at http://andrewdupont.net/2006/05/18/javascript-associative-arrays-considered-harmful/

comment.author: roelofb
comment.text: * '''Resolution''' set to ''Applied''. * '''Version Fixed''' set to ''Future''. * '''Status''' changed from ''Open'' to ''Resolved''.
